# spacelift_plugin_template (Resource)

`spacelift_plugin_template` represents a Spacelift **plugin template** - a reusable template that defines a plugin's behavior and can be instantiated multiple times as plugins.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "spacelift_plugin_template" "example" {
  name     = "opentofu-testing"
  manifest = file("./opentofu-testing-manifest.yaml")
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `manifest` (String) The plugin manifest defining the plugin's behavior
- `name` (String) Name of the plugin template

### Optional

- `description` (String) Free-form plugin template description
- `labels` (Set of String) Labels to apply to the plugin template

### Read-Only

- `created_at` (Number) Timestamp when the plugin template was created
- `id` (String) Immutable ID of the plugin template
- `is_global` (Boolean) Whether this is a global (Spacelift-provided) plugin template
- `parameters` (List of Object) Parameters extracted from the manifest (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--parameters))
- `updated_at` (Number) Timestamp when the plugin template was last updated

<a id="nestedatt--parameters"></a>
### Nested Schema for `parameters`

Read-Only:

- `default` (String)
- `description` (String)
- `id` (String)
- `name` (String)
- `required` (Boolean)
- `sensitive` (Boolean)
- `type` (String)

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
tofu import spacelift_plugin_template.example $PLUGIN_TEMPLATE_ID
```
